szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors

Class AbstractMoveableActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors.AbstractActor
      • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors.AbstractMoveableActor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActorBasic, ActorPrivileged, ActorUpdatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bullet, Mole, PipeHead

    public abstract class AbstractMoveableActor
extends AbstractActor
    An extension to the base AbstractActor class providing helper functionality for moving actors.

    • Method Detail

      • setDirection

        protected void setDirection(Direction direction)
        After updating the actor's orientation, resets the result returned by boundReached() to false, as it is assumed the actor has not reached a boundary in the new direction.
        Overrides:
        setDirection in class AbstractActor
        Parameters:
        direction - the new direction the actor should be facing in.

      • move

        protected void move(int dxAbs,
                    int dyAbs,
                    Direction dir)

        Moves the actor and updates the tunnel cell it is located in by calling ActorRectangle.overlaps().

        If the direction value passed is different from the current value returned by getDirection(), it also sets it and checks to see if a bound has been reached in the given direction.

        Parameters:
        dxAbs - the absolute value of the shift in horizontal coordinates
        dyAbs - the absolute value of the shift in vertical coordinates
        dir - the direction of movement.

      • move

        protected void move(int dx,
                    int dy)
        Same as move(int, int, Direction) except that the direction of movement is calculated from the values of dx and dy. Note that unlike the former, this method throws an exception if both values are nonzero.
        Parameters:
        dx - the signed change of the horizontal coordinate.
        dy - the signed change of the vertical coordinate.

      • boundReached

        protected boolean boundReached()
        Checks if the end of a tunnel has been reached in the given direction.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the end of a tunnel in the current direction was reached | false otherwise.
